I tried to find the answer to this, and was wondering if you could help (this is absolutely a shameless attempt to get hints as to what my biopsy results might be)... Why would a doctor order a Core Needle over a Fine Needle biopsy? Is one more indicitive of cancer than the other?  Also, what should I expect? Is it painful? I'm going alone and dont want to start crying and become a hot mess. Nobody would be my friend after that. So I am trying to prepare myself, and Dr. Google is not being very comforting tonight. Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2012 02:13PM skapaya wrote: Hey Sandik, Good news! It looks like an intraductal papilloma which is a BENIGN (YAY) tumor. I am scheduled for an Excisional Biopsy on the 2nd to make sure that the surrounding tissue is cancer free, and there aren't any rogue cells hanging about. The doc doesnt seem to concerned, so niether am I.
Posts.Title: Fine Needle vs Core Needle Biopsy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2012 07:03PM skapaya wrote: I experienced something similar yesterday. The doctor doing the U/S guided biopy saw the mass on the previous U/S, but had a hard time finding it on his own. When he did find it, he said "is that even real"? He did some more looking around, and I suggested that maybe he not stick me with the big scary needle if he didnt think it was real. He responded, that it "stood out", and had an irregular shape, so he wanted to be sure. The biopsy continued as planned, and I took his comments as a good sign. He explained the U/S were not an exact science when it came it detecting BC. I wish they would just give is breast MRI's instead.

Posts.Title: Waiting for pathology report and "hello". kymL skapaya

Posts.Content: skapaya wrote: Why do people say everything is going to be ok… when … in reality they have no idea? I wont know definitively rather or not I’m ok… for what seems like forever. My nipples were hurting. Both of them. Little compasses pointing towards an undeniable fact, something is not right. I don’t have a uterus… a necessary extraction after a very tough pregnancy. So, I assumed that the changes in my breasts had to be hormonal. Menopause, maybe? The men in my house would not be ready for that adventure. Maybe an ovarian cyst wrecking hormonal havoc? I wasn’t sure, and the pain was annoying so I made an appointment with my OBGYN. She walks in, and I recite the speech I practiced in my head. I have a unique medical history, that requires me to summarize my medical record succinctly. “ Hey Doc. So, My body likes to grow things. Gall stones, cysts, fibroids, and organ eating placentas. As a result, I no longer have a uterus. I have my ovaries, and I’ve been poked, squished and prodded more times than I like. Just this week, I finally finished a project that I’m hoping will keep me very busy. So, whatever is going on in my breasts… I need it to be something I can take medication for. A simple explanation that doesn’t require being poked or prodded” A simple request really. I just don’t have time for another medical question mark. The doctor examines me, and asks tons of questions. I respond, making light of, and trying to discourage her now serious fondling of my right breast. “Yes. I noticed the dimple in my breast. It’s kind of wrinkly. Guess we all get old.” “Are you sure that’s a lump? I’ve had them before, that feels more like a long grain of rice” “I’m pretty sure this is all apart of menopause” She patiently explains that at 33 I’m much to young for menopause, even though I don’t have a uterus. She apologizes and says, I think you’re going to have to be poked and prodded. She orders an ultrasound. Being the type that is prone to grow things, I call me breast doctor and schedule an appointment. They know me there. In the past three years I’ve had 4 mammograms, countless ultrasounds, a lumpectomy, and 3 biopsies. All benign. I call, and schedule an appointment. I meet with my breast doctor, and she gives me an ultrasound. She is a very serious looking lady. Tall and thin. She has short blond, almost platinum hair. She is kind, but not overtly emotional. She has great poker face. I hear words, and I hang on to the ones I want to Google later. “Solid Mass. Shadowing. Biopsy” She tries to show me what she sees on the ultrasound machine. It all looks like grey matter to me. I lie. I tell her I see what she sees. I think to myself, WOW, she is really into this. I try to gauge her concern. Does she look worried? I can’t tell. She tells me she would feel better if I had a newer mammogram. I schedule a mammogram for the following day, and a biopsy for a few days later. I walk out the exam room to checkout. I wonder if the people handling my chart no something I don’t. Are they being nice to me because they think I have cancer? I’m over analyzing everything. I can’t wait to ask Dr. Google some questions. I make it to my mammogram the next day. It’s early in the morning. Dr. Google informed me that mammograms reports are often times given a BIRADS number. It’s a number that rates the likelihood of cancer, and offers suggestions for next steps. 1 means it’s all-good in the hood. 5 means, sorry kid. We’re pretty sure it’s cancer. My mission… get my BIRADS score. I have a plan, I will ask the radiologist what my score is. I don’t. I freeze. Why do I freeze? I muster some courage and ask for a copy of the report at checkout. They tell me it’s not ready. I then remember that all my reports post to my online patient portal. I’ll get an email letting me know that it’s in. So the stalking begins. I stalk my email. Waiting. Waiting for news… that is not definitive… but a better indicator of rather or not I am ok. I try to remember The Secret…. Words are things. Positive thoughts, Mya. Think Positive. Then I am bombarded with self-doubt. Can positive thoughts cure what already is? Can it reverse the worst scenario? Why did this lump feel so much different than my other ones. How come I didn’t recognize it as a lump? Positive thoughts. Positive thoughts.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling like a ticking time bomb skapaya Ddkath70

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2014 07:33AM skapaya wrote: No mammogram results yet. I've been checking the email for an update to my online chart with the type of anticipation one has when expecting a call from a crush.  Thinking that any information is better than none, I asked my doctor for the notes from the ultrasound. Nothing terribly informative there either. I was hoping for more adjectives. Words that could help me describe to doctor google exactly what was seen. Instead, all I learned is that I had a solid mass, 1cm, and the Impression is indeterminate. Indeterminate seemed to be less ominous then "highly suspicious", until I googled it. So I wait. I'd feel better knowing the BI-RADS score, I think. I mean... Having a probability of some sort seems more manageable then being in the dark. I'm rambling. Time for work.

Posts.Content: skapaya wrote: Hello All,  This waiting sucks... doesn't it? My name is Mya, and I am 31 years old. I felt a lump in my breast, and after a couple of weeks I finally made an appointment with my doctor. I waited to make the appointment because I wasnt exactly sure what I was feeling was a lump. What I  feel is thick, not exactly round, and it doesn't seem to move. It's small. Like the size of a pea. I guess it just didnt feel what I thought a lump should feel like.  I did know, that is wasnt  "normal". I was really surprised when the doctor was able to find the lump without any direction from me. It validated that what I was feeling was "real", and for the first time felt a little scared.  She told me that it was really small, but she wanted me to get a diagnositic mammogram as soon as possible. She told me that if I was asked to wait longer than 2 days, to call back and get a referral to someone else. Her urgency scared me a bit. My appointment is on Wednesday. I was told that a doctor would be present during the mammogram, so I wont have to wait for results (small victory).  Hopefully it is just a cyst.  I am telling people I am not worried, and I am sure everything will be fine. That's not exactly the truth. I have 3 sons, and a great husband, and I am scared.  I'm hoping that I can find someone who is on a journey similar to mine that I can buddy with. I imagine that going through this with someone who has gone through it before would be less stressful. Anybody out there? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Sending B9 vibes to all of you!!

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2012 12:06PM skapaya wrote: Hello Ladies, @cariboob In december they told me it was "probably" nothing and to come back in 3 months. I also refused to examine myself those months. Probably a mistake. @dmacw It does suck. What sucks even more is that I called the doctors office back, and convinced the lady to have a nurse give me the results. Only to find out that my path report actually DIDNT come in, and the receoptionist was refering to my ultrasound report . Not sure how one makes that mistake, but it sure did have me on an emotional roller coaster. @harley63 Thank you so much for your support. Coming to this site and reading kind works means so much. @Diane5 This site is a godsend. Glad you found it! Thinking positive b9 thoughts for you.

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2012 11:06AM skapaya wrote: So... Got a call from the doctors office saying my results came in, and I needs to schedule an appointment to go over the results. I asked if I could just be told over the phone, and the lady scheduling the appointment said no, it was aganist the law . I asked if the doc could call me, or if a nurse could call me and give me the results over the phone and she said she would ask. I also asked for a hint, and she said she couldnt to that (it was worth a try). I then called the hospital where I had the biopsy and they said that I could request a copy, and they would be able to mail me a copy of the report in 3-5 days.  So it looks like I'll have to wait until Wednesday at 2:30 to find out results. More waiting.
